newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Piper cautious on Avid.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Piper cautious on Avid.

text.p: -- Piper Jaffray said it expects the resignation of Avid Technology Inc president Daniel Keshian to lead the company to take longer to implement a turnaround in its results than Wall Street has expected.

-- The brokerage said that while Avid chairman and chief executive Bill Miller, who is assuming Keshian's responsibilities, has experience running manufacturing and operations, it believes he will require time to become acquainted with the demands of the video market.
-- The firm reiterated its market performer rating. It holds a fiscal 1997 earnings estimate of $0.52 per share.
-- The stock was off 5/8 to 17-7/8 at midday Friday.
